intro: Ramusia tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed ramusia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves with three lobes. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
